title: How to learn a topic - Quora

response.answer_text: Start by redefining the question because this is a really vague one. I suppose you mean learning as learning in school. The way I study is to learn chapter by chapter and work in layers. Start with chapter one and learn the table of contents if that’s useful. Then, I would learn the big lines and work my way to the details. However, don’t get lost in them.When you finish learning a chapter, reflect on what you just learned and try to say it to yourself (and I mean out loud).I would also recommend answering a few questions on that chapter if there are any available. Last but not least; repeat, repeat, repeat, repeat….!!!!!

Whenever you read a topic . Just read it by full concentration. And then go in front of mirror and explain it to yourself that what have you read and what did you understood from it Try to practice on board as like you are teaching someone Or after reading and understanding write in an notebook that what you have learnt
